title: EKS
control_title: EKS clusters should not use multiple security groups

title: Use the command aws eks describe-cluster --name <cluster-name> --query ""cluster.resourcesVpcConfig.securityGroupIds"" to identify all associated security groups. Simplify your setup by creating a single security group with clear rules, allowing necessary inbound traffic and restricting access to required ports. Audit and modify the rules to ensure adherence to the principle of least privilege, removing unnecessary open ports or wildcard rules. Finally, update the cluster configuration with aws eks update-cluster-config --name <cluster-name> --resources-vpc-config securityGroupIds=<new-security-group-id>."

title: RDS

Log into the AWS Management Console, navigate to RDS, and select “Create database.” When configuring the database, ensure that the “Storage encryption” option is enabled. For existing unencrypted instances, take a snapshot and create a new instance from that snapshot with encryption enabled.

title: RDS

Specify the notification method, such as an SNS topic.

title: RDS

title: RDS

Save changes and apply them either immediately or during the next maintenance window

title: RDS
control_title: RDS instances should be deployed in a VPC

title: Security
